text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I am Santos a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Portland today I am going to show you
how to assign a custom primary private
IP address to an Amazon elastic compute
Cloud instance let's get started the
feasibility of assigning a cust cem
private IP address depends on many
factors but the most important of them
is whether the instance is an existing
instance or if it is ready to be
launched for existing instances it is
not possible to assign a new custom
primary private address because the
primary interface is directly associated
with the instance and you cannot detach
or delete the primary
interface however you can always
associate disassociate and then modify a
secondary private address of the
instance you can assign a custom primary
private IP address for an instance that
is not at large however there are
certain conditions that must be
made the custom private IP must be a
valid IP address
the IP address must be in the CER range
of the chosen
subnet the IP address must be available
that is it must not be tied to any
resource after all the conditions are
made you can associate the custom
private IP address as the primary
private address to your ec2 instance
note that this Association is Possible
only when the instance is configured at
launch let's go to the AWS Management
console and see how to do
this after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the ec2
console choose instances then select the
launch instances
button here you can enter a descriptive
name for the
instance choose quick start under
application and Os images Amazon machine
image and then choose the operating
system OS for your
instance under key paay login choose an
existing key pairer or create a new
one now choose the edit button under
networking setting settings choose an
existing VPC for your
instance and then select a
subnet now use a security group to
define a firewall rules for your
instance then expand the advanced
network
configuration make sure that the device
index is zero and that the network
interface selected is a new interface
here you can select one or more security
groups now let's enter the custom
private IP address under the primary IP
section select the summary panel to
review your instance configuration and
then choose launch
instance so now you know how to assign a
custom primary private IP address to an
Amazon elastic compute Cloud instance
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
AWS
